name: symbiosis
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing symbiosis cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`symbiosis` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/symbiosis-cloud/terraform-provider-symbiosis).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing symbiosis cloud resources.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/symbiosis-cloud/terraform-provider-symbiosis)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-symbiosis` repo](https://github.com/symbiosis-cloud/pulumi-symbiosis/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-symbiosis` repo](https://github.com/symbiosis-cloud/terraform-provider-symbiosis/issues).

python.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/symbiosis-cloud/terraform-provider-symbiosis)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,

> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-symbiosis` repo](https://github.com/symbiosis-cloud/terraform-provider-symbiosis/issues).

apiKey.description: The ApiKey used to authenticate requests towards Symbiosis.

endpoint.description: Endpoint for reaching the symbiosis API. Used for debugging or when accessed through a proxy.

effect.description: Taint effect. Can be either NoSchedule, PreferNoSchedule or NoExecute. See: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/scheduling-eviction/taint-and-toleration/

provider.description:
The provider type for the symbiosis package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

isHighlyAvailable.description: When set to true it will deploy a highly available control plane with multiple replicas for redundancy.

kubeVersion.description: Kubernetes version, see symbiosis.host for valid values or "latest" for the most recent supported version.

name.description: Cluster name. Changing the name forces re-creation.

acceptedInvitation.description: Whether the user has accepted the invitation to the team.

email.description: User email to invite. Adding an team member will send the user an invitation. Deleting a team member will either delete the invitation or the user depending on whether the user has accepted the invitation.

role.description: User role. Valid values include [MEMBER, ADMIN].
